title: Kinetic Portal
description:
This project focused on boosting HR and administrative efficiency. It introduced a unified platform that handled leave and overtime requests, internal job postings, and employee contracts. Key features included a resume format for daily applicants, a payroll schedule manager, and advanced activity reports. Built to streamline HR operations, the platform improved employee experience and workflow.

Key Contribution:
• Automated Late WebJobs to run every 30 minutes, improving attendance tracking and cutting absenteeism response time by 25%.
• Built WebJobs to pull 100,000+ daily data points from APIs (Holiday, Screenshot Monitor, Time Doctor, Hubstaff), boosting data accuracy and reducing manual input.
• Created a Booking Calendar with FullCalendar to automate orientation scheduling for 63,000+ candidates.
• Developed a timesheet monitor for 4,000+ team members, improving accountability and reducing errors.
• Supported 70+ internal users by quickly resolving app issues, ensuring smooth business operations.
• Built a sessionization algorithm to reconstruct continuous sessions from raw Hubstaff logs — increasing time-tracking accuracy by 90% for over 4,000 users.
• Redesigned and optimized complex SQL Server queries handling 9 million candidate records, implementing strategic indexing, query plan optimization, and stored procedure refactoring to enhance database performance and user experience.
• Strengthened application security by implementing user role-based access control for API authorization, integrating JWT token validation for secure authentication, and utilizing parameterized queries with Dapper to eliminate SQL injection vulnerabilities.
• Implemented AES-256 encryption to secure team members' salary data at rest, ensuring confidentiality and compliance with data protection standards.
• Implemented materialized views as a database-level caching strategy to precompute and store query results, reducing response times and improving performance for read-intensive workloads.

title: Xamun Dev Portal
description:
A full-code platform for startups and digital projects—faster and simpler than Low-Code.

Key Contribution:
• Wrote PowerShell scripts for Azure Pipelines to automate CI/CD, cut deployment time, and reduce errors.
• Integrated workflows using the DrawFlow library to streamline process design.
• Built a reusable Angular schematics library to speed up development and ensure UI consistency.
• Deployed scalable web apps with Azure and Docker, boosting release speed and system stability.
• Set up secure external logins with IdentityServer4, connecting Facebook, Google, and AzureAD to simplify user access.
• Built an Azure Services Class Library with Polly for resilient communication between services, incorporating retry logic and a circuit breaker pattern to enhance fault tolerance.

title: Rivington (Collections Application, AMIG Application, Centauri Application)
description:
Rivington Partners is a managing general agency that focuses on writing specialty property & casualty insurance and placing risk with sponsoring insurance carriers.

Key Contribution:
• Built a Reports API using ClosedXML and LargeXLSX .NET to handle payments, premiums, cancellations, and endorsements.
• Led development of a Claims feature to import external data into the RivTech Star App, improving data integration.
• Developed and managed Azure Functions to automate daily and monthly financial transaction reports, enabling timely, accurate insights and supporting high-volume payment processing workflows.
• Built and tested complex reporting logic for premium tracking—covering inforce, written, earned, and unearned—ensuring compliance and accuracy.
• Led backend improvements focused on performance, research, and new development efforts.
• Developed dynamic, state-based forms tailored for U.S. users to improve data input and UX.
• Upgraded the backend from .NET Core 2.1 to .NET 5.0, modernizing the stack and boosting performance.
• Migrated Azure Functions to .NET 5.0 Isolated Process to improve scalability and cloud performance.

title: Daikin E-commerce
description:
Daikin Philippines runs an online store for air purifiers, enabling customers to browse and purchase products seamlessly.

Key Contribution:
• Implemented end-to-end payment integration with Paynamics for enabling secure transaction processing and handling card payment flows.
• Built webhooks, APIs, and blob storage systems with SQL scripts and social login via Facebook and Google.
• Designed and implemented Split Pay functionality with Paynamics, enabling automated payment segregation to multiple stakeholders (merchants, logistics, digital platforms) during a single customer transaction, with convenience fees configured per payment channel — e.g., Credit/Debit Cards (4% + ₱20), Online Bank Transfer/E-Wallets (2.5%), Over-the-Counter (₱25), and Installments (0.60% for credit cards, 2.50% for non-credit).

title: Daikin Virtual Showroom
description:
Daikin's Virtual Showroom helps customers explore products without visiting a physical store, providing an immersive online browsing experience.

Key Contribution:
• Boosted API performance for the Virtual Showroom through focused optimization.
• Developed CRUD APIs and service classes to manage data more efficiently.
• Designed the ERD for the Virtual Showroom database to support structured data storage and fast retrieval.

title: iScan Diagnostic Center
description:
iScan offers fast, reliable medical imaging services, powered by a skilled and patient-focused team.

Key Contribution:
• Built backend workflows for release and notification modules, improving control and speeding up communication.
• Developed and maintained an Azure Function to automate alerts, boosting response time and cutting manual work.
• Set up SMTP for email alerts and integrated Telerivet for SMS, ensuring reliable, multi-channel messaging.

title: My Scorecard (Mundipharma)
description:
A web app that processes sales data and calculates employee incentives. Exports payout summaries and reports directly to Excel.

Key Contribution:
• Led web development using .NET Core, React.js, and Redux.
• Deployed the app using Jenkins and IIS.
• Overhauled report generation workflows to improve speed and clarity.

title: Magsaysay Online Careers
description:
A mobile and web-based HR platform for end-to-end recruitment. Built for ease of use and seamless hiring.

Key Contribution:
• Integrated Zoom API to streamline meetings and boost communication.
• Debugged the codebase thoroughly to resolve issues fast and keep the app reliable.

title: Marius
description:
Marius is a cyber-insurance platform for clients, underwriters, and system admins. It manages policies from application to endorsement, renewal, cancellation, and claims.

Key Contribution:
• Built secure upload/download features using Azure Blob Storage to manage files at scale.
• Developed modules for quote binding and bind requests, speeding up policy handling and boosting efficiency.
• Developed modules for payments, endorsements, and cancellations to ensure accurate transactions and improve user satisfaction.

title: Tempest Asset Management
description:
This system lets school staff track repairs from start to finish—from part usage to student restoration time. Accessible from any browser, anytime, on any device.

Key Contribution:
• Built reusable components and services across API, backend, and frontend.
• Improved and added features to the web app for the TIG user base.

title: Catalyst
description:
A code generator tool that helps build high-quality software faster.

Key Contribution:
• Built a full client app from scratch using Angular 9.
• Set up and deployed the Angular schematic project as npm package.
• Integrated Azure services including Queue, Function, Table, Cosmos DB, and Storage.

title: HomeQube
description:
Homeqube builds performance systems to tackle global housing shortages. It champions decentralization, open access, and breaking down barriers in knowledge, production, and supply.

Key Contribution:
• Researched and applied tools like Plotly.js, Leaflet.js, and Pako.js to meet stakeholder needs.
• Built reusable components and services for both front-end and back-end development.

title: Chess Book Analyzer
description:
A web-based chess book analyzer built as a personal project for studying chess openings and games interactively. It lets users load chess books (PDF/DjVu/ePub), display them side-by-side with an interactive chessboard, and analyze positions with Stockfish engine evaluation — all running locally in the browser with no server required.

Key Features:
• Interactive chessboard with drag-and-drop piece movement, move navigation, and board annotations (arrows and highlights).
• Integrated Stockfish engine analysis running via Web Workers for real-time position evaluation.
• Built-in book reader supporting PDF, DjVu, and ePub formats with a resizable split-panel layout.
• PGN export and full move history with NAG annotation support (!, ?, !!, ??, etc.).
• Tree-based variation/branching system for exploring side lines without losing the main line.
• IndexedDB persistence to save and restore study sessions across browser reloads.
• PWA-ready with offline capability — fully runs in the browser with zero backend dependency.

Tech Stack: Vanilla JavaScript, chess.js (v1.x), chessboard.js, Stockfish WASM, PDF.js, DjVu.js, ePub.js, IndexedDB.

title: KCMJ Sari-Sari Store POS
description:
A full-featured Point of Sale (POS) system built for a family-owned sari-sari store. Designed for daily retail operations with real-time inventory tracking, sales monitoring, and credit management — optimized for tablet and mobile use by non-technical users.

Key Features:
• Dashboard overview with today's sales, cash on hand, profit, petty cash, and outstanding credit (utang) summary.
• Real-time inventory management with best sellers ranking, stock velocity tracking, days-left estimates, and low stock alerts.
• QR code scanning and manual product search for fast checkout.
• Credit/Utang system with per-customer balance tracking, payment recording, and overdue alerts (30+ days).
• Cash register management with starting balance, cash-out, petty cash, and full audit trail history.
• Sales trend charts (7-day and 3-month) and best sellers analytics by revenue and quantity.
• Purchase expense tracking for monitoring spending on goods for resale.
• Dual-mode support: Admin dashboard with full controls and a simplified Sales Terminal for cashiers.
• Built with Angular 19, Supabase (PostgreSQL + Auth + RLS), and SCSS with a mobile-first responsive design.

title: ChessLab AE
description:
A Dubai-based chess academy website built for ChessLab AE, a training platform led by International Masters, FIDE Certified Instructors, and Sports Psychologists. The site serves as the digital front for their coaching programs, tournament events, and community engagement — helping players of all levels from beginners to competitive tournament players.

Key Features:
• Landing page with a video background hero section showcasing the academy's brand and call-to-action for booking assessments.
• Structured training roadmap displaying three learning tiers — First Movers (beginner), Star Class (intermediate), and Elite Class (advanced) — each with Google Calendar booking integration.
• Team profiles section highlighting coaches and staff with their titles, certifications, and personal quotes.
• Events section featuring recent and upcoming FIDE-rated tournaments with event details and registration links.
• Client testimonials carousel with reviews from parents and chess players.
• FAQ accordion section addressing common questions about programs, age requirements, coaching qualifications, and class formats.
• Multi-branch contact section with Google Maps integration, WhatsApp link, social media links, and operating hours.
• Fully responsive design optimized for desktop and mobile devices.

Tech Stack: WordPress, Softaculous.
